inlineContent.text: Welcome to the Gnusto Interactive Fiction Engine! Gnusto is a powerful and flexible Swift-based
framework designed to help you create rich, dynamic text adventure games. Inspired by the
classic Infocom masterpieces, Gnusto provides a modern toolkit that simplifies the development
of interactive narratives, allowing you to focus on storytelling and world-building.
Whether you’re a seasoned interactive fiction author or new to the genre, Gnusto offers an
approachable yet robust platform for bringing your interactive stories to life.
At its heart, creating a game with Gnusto involves defining your game world, its inhabitants,
and the rules that govern their interactions.

content.text: Defining Your World: Locations and Items

inlineContent.text: The foundation of your game is built from
represents a distinct place or room that the player can visit. You define
a location with a unique ID, a name, a textual description that sets the scene for the
player, and exits that connect it to other locations.
Here’s how you might define a simple cloakroom:

code: The walls of this small room were clearly once lined with hooks,
though now only one remains. The exit is a door to the east.

inlineContent.text: : This is often used as the heading when describing the location.
: The text paints a picture of the location for the player.

is any object, character, or other entity that the player can interact with.
Like locations, items have an ID, a name, a description, and various attributes that
Let’s add a cloak for the player, and a brass hook to the cloakroom to hang it on:

code: A handsome cloak, of velvet trimmed with satin, and slightly
spattered with raindrops. Its blackness is so deep that it
almost seems to suck light from the room.

Creating a game with Gnusto generally follows these steps:
Sketch out your map, puzzles, items, and story.
s using their respective initializers and attributes, often grouped within an

This brings together your areas, vocabulary, and initial game settings.
Gnusto is built with game creators in mind, offering features that simplify development:
Create living worlds with state-driven descriptions and behaviors using
A flexible pipeline processes player commands, allowing for complex interactions and easy customization of game verbs.
Gnusto’s parser understands natural language, supporting synonyms, adjectives, and complex sentence structures.
Easily track and modify game progress, item states, player attributes, and timed events (
The engine is designed for modularity. Add custom behaviors, new actions, or even entirely new systems without fighting the core framework.
) for a playable demonstration of Gnusto’s capabilities.
Dive deeper into specific components like
s by exploring their detailed documentation.
Consult the rest of the documentation for more information on project structure and engine-level concepts.

abstract.text: Handles the “THINK ABOUT” command, allowing the player to ponder an item or themselves.
This is a more introspective action, often resulting in a generic or humorous response.
Handles the “READ” command, allowing the player to attempt to read text from an item.
Handles the “TURN ON” command, allowing the player to activate items that are
considered devices (e.g., light sources).
